business.headline: India considers easing curbs on Chinese firms in government contracts: ReportThe curbs have had a significant economic impact, effectively excluding Chinese firms from Indian government projects worth between nearly $700 billion and $750 billion.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: Sensex ends 780 points lower, Nifty falls below 26,000The Sensex closed 780 points lower, while the Nifty slipped under the psychologically important 26,000 level, reflecting growing investor caution amid mixed global cues and stock-specific pressure in frontline names. The fall was widespread, with most sectoral indices ending in negative territory.

What India's 2025 tax filings reveal about a changing economyIndia's 2025 tax returns offer a rare glimpse into a changing economic mindset. From side businesses to market investments, taxpayers are no longer relying on a single stream of income.

How Venezuela slipped out of India's oil shopping listOnce a strategic crude supplier, Venezuela has slipped to the margins of India's oil imports, showing how sanctions and geopolitics can override commercial logic in global energy trade.

Budget 2026: What do experts want on tax reform, stability and compliance?Budget 2026 just around the corner, hopes are high for reforms that promote growth, compliance, and simplicity in India's tax and business environment.

Sensex closes 780 points lower: 5 reasons why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 780.18 points to close at 84,180.96, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 263.90 points to end at 25,876.85. The broader market also closed in the red, reflecting weak sentiment across the board.

Budget 2026: Real estate sector seeks tax relief and policy clarityAs the countdown to Budget 2026 begins, the real estate sector is looking to the government to revisit tax rules and housing definitions to better match today's urban market realities.

New Income Tax rules from April 2026: What will change for taxpayersIndia is set to usher in a new Income Tax law from April 1, 2026. The new Income Tax Act aims to simplify tax rules, improve clarity and make compliance easier for taxpayers in an increasingly digital system.

Promoter families seek Sebi nod on daughters-in-law under takeover rules: ReportOver the past decade, an increasing number of business families have moved promoter holdings, or portions of them, into private family trusts, with family members as beneficiaries.

Why France's generous pension system is becoming an economic burdenWhat was once seen as a pillar of social security is now becoming a growing strain on public finances, as demographic and economic pressures mount.

Thinking of moving abroad? These places charge zero income taxAcross the world, around 19 countries do not charge personal income tax. They are spread across the Middle East, the Caribbean, parts of Europe, and the Pacific.

Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will give away 75% wealth to fulfil dead son's wishWith his son's death, Anil Agarwal says his commitment to give away over 75% of earnings stands firm, signalling a deeper shift toward philanthropy, simpler living, and long-term social investment beyond business success.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets ignore fresh US tariff threat; TCS down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 116.63 points to 84,844.51, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 33.70 points to 26,107.05 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will market open lower after 500% tariff threat from US?Markets have been under pressure for several sessions. The Nifty 50 has slipped 0.7% over the last three trading days, while the BSE Sensex has declined 0.9% during the same period.

Trump bars defence company payouts until weapons production speeds upTrump and senior Pentagon officials have repeatedly criticised major defence companies for failing to deliver weapons and systems at the pace demanded by modern conflicts. They have argued that lengthy delays and ballooning budgets weaken US military readiness and undermine taxpayer confidence.

Darkest day of my life: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal's son dies of cardiac arrest at 49Agarwal's post referenced a longstanding pledge made between father and son to support several social priorities, such as food access, education for children, empowering women, and secure employment for young Indians. Agarwal renewed the promise to devote over 75% of group earnings to initiatives that benefit society.

Union Budget to be presented on Sunday, Feb 1; Economic Survey on Jan 29This will be only the second time the Union Budget will be presented on a Sunday. In 1999, the Budget was presented on a Sunday for the first time.

Silver jumps Rs 5000 to hit record high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kg in Delhi marketsSilver prices jumped by Rs 5,000 to a fresh all-time high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kilogram in the Delhi market, driven by strong safe-haven demand, robust industrial buying and supply concerns.

Budget 2026: Why insurance and policy reforms are in focusAs Budget 2026 approaches, the insurance industry is pushing for structural tax reforms, enhanced retirement security, and measures to improve access to inclusive insurance products, focusing on how policy direction will impact premium financing and sector growth.

Netflix offering better value: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised hostile bidParamount launched a hostile takeover bid worth USD 108.4 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery on December 8, disrupting Warner Bros' preliminary merger talks with Netflix.

entertainment.headline: Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV, ZEE5: Freedom at Midnight 2, Balti and more OTT platforms have a packed release week with new films and series across Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV and ZEE5. From Freedom at Midnight Season 2 and The Night Manager Season 2 to fresh thrillers like Weapons and Mask, viewers are spoilt for choice.

After Toxic teaser, RGV calls Geetu Mohandas 'ultimate symbol of women empowerment' The teaser for Yash's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups has sparked major buzz, with filmmakers Ram Gopal Varma and Sandeep Vanga hailing director Geetu Mohandas as a symbol of women empowerment. The dark, stylish thriller is slated for release on March 19, 2026.

Varun Dhawan faces body-shaming as Reddit post alleges paid trolling over Border 2 Varun Dhawan found himself at the centre of a massive trolling wave after Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2 went viral. Now, a Reddit post alleging a paid trolling campaign has raised fresh questions about how the backlash against the actor was orchestrated.

Vicky Kaushal's father Sham Kaushal writes heartfelt message for grandson Vihaan Actor Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have publicly introduced their newborn son as Vihaan Kaushal, prompting a heartfelt response from grandfather Sham Kaushal and an outpouring of affection from fans.

Voice of today's India: Alia Bhatt heaps praises on Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Bollywood actor Alia Bhatt has joined a growing list of celebrities commending the film Dhurandhar. The Ranveer Singh-starrer has become the highest-grossing Hindi film to date, earning recognition for both its storytelling and performances.

Divya Spandana questions Supreme Court stand on stray dogs in viral post Former MP and actor Divya Spandana has sparked debate by comparing the Supreme Court's concerns on stray dogs to human behaviour on social media. The court highlighted risks posed by stray animals on roads and urged stricter action against non-compliant states.

Netflix this week: De De Pyaar De 2, Taskaree and more Netflix is rolling out a packed slate this week with new films and series across genres, including De De Pyaar De 2, His & Hers and Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web.

When Priyanka Chopra admitted feeling guilty leaving daughter Malti at home Priyanka Chopra has spoken about experiencing "mom's guilt" when work commitments require her to leave her two-year-old daughter, Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, at home.

Sobhita Dhulipala leads new Telugu crime thriller Cheekatilo. Check release date The Prime Original film Cheekatilo, set in Hyderabad and led by Sobhita Dhulipala, will release on Prime Video in India and over 240 countries and territories worldwide on January 23.

Kiara Advani trained with international artists for Cirque-style act in Toxic Kiara Advani prepares for her role as an acrobat in Geetu Mohandas' film Toxic, working with international performers to deliver a visual described as unprecedented in Indian cinema. The film, also starring Yash, is set for release in March 2026.

After Jana Nayagan's postponement, can Prabhas' The Raja Saab get over low buzz? Prabhas' The Raja Saab gets a clear advantage after Jana Nayagan postpones its release. The film's success now hinges on its appeal beyond Telugu states amid limited North India promotion.

To be continued? After Dhurandhar, are Love & War King considering two-part release The massive success of Ranveer Singh-led Dhurandhar has reopened the debate on whether two-part films can still work in theatres, if done right.

The Pitt renewed for Season 3 ahead of Season 2 premiere on January 9 The medical drama The Pitt has been renewed for a third season by HBO Max, just ahead of its Season 2 premiere. The announcement came during a premiere event in Los Angeles, reaffirming the show's continued focus on the lives of healthcare workers at a Pittsburgh hospital.

New Jackass film is officially heading to theatres this June Paramount Pictures has announced that a new Jackass film will hit cinemas in June, marking the franchise's return four years after the last instalment.

Naagin 7 debuts at second position; Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi retains top rank Naagin 7 made a notable entrance by becoming the second most-watched television show in its debut week, but Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi continued to lead the viewership charts, according to BARC India ratings.

Rohit Shetty gets candid about not winning an award after 17 films Rohit Shetty jokingly said he has no connection with awards despite directing 17 successful films, during a recent press meet in Mumbai.

Vivek Oberoi says Dhurandhar rips the envelope like Animal, praises Aditya Dhar Actor Vivek Oberoi has commended Aditya Dhar's film 'Dhurandhar' after it became the highest-grossing Hindi film ever. He drew comparisons to Ranbir Kapoor's Animal and highlighted the film's impact and performances.

Why was Vijay's Jana Nayagan postponed? Censor delay and court battle explained Why was Vijay's Jana Nayagan postponed just two days before release? Here's a detailed timeline of the CBFC delay, court intervention, box-office fallout and what happens next.

Park Min-young's new K-drama, Yumi's Cells 3: Studio Dragon's 2026 slate K-drama fans will enjoy a star-driven slate in early 2026 with diverse genres and familiar faces. The season promises fresh storytelling blending nostalgia, mystery, and emotional depth.

general news.headline: Mamata Banerjee forcibly removed files: ED vs I-PAC reaches High Court UpdatesThe ED said the searches at the residence of I-PAC chief Pratik Jain in Kolkata and the group's office were peaceful till Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee arrived with 'a large number of police officers'. Read on to find out what happened next.

Main accused in Dipu Das lynching arrested, Bangladesh cops say he incited mobPolice in Bangladesh's Mymensingh region have arrested the main suspect, Yasin Arafat, in the violent mob lynching of Hindu garment worker Dipu Das.

Sensex closes 780 points lower: 5 reasons why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 780.18 points to close at 84,180.96, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 263.90 points to end at 25,876.85. The broader market also closed in the red, reflecting weak sentiment across the board.

Fighter jets to help Pak stop taking IMF loans: Khwaja Asif's pants are on firePakistan's Defence Minister, Khwaja Asif, has claimed that Islamabad was getting record orders for fighter jets and might not need IMF's financial assistance after six months. This, he said, came after the four-day mini-war with India. Saudi Arabia, for one, is considering a jets-for-loan deal. Here's a look at Pakistan's public debt and liabilities vis-a-vis Asif's claim.

As Censor Board puts Jana Nayagan on pause mode, Vijay fans smell a rat Vijay's Jana Nayagan has been delayed after the Censor Board refused certification, causing financial strain and sparking political speculation. In Tamil Nadu, where cinema and politics often overlap, some see the controversy as possible central interference ahead of elections.

What Poland said about India as US turns up heat over Russian oilWe are satisfied, said Poland Foreign Minister Radosaw Sikorski as he backed India as New Delhi faces sharp tariff threats from the US over its continued imports of Russian crude oil.

ED raids, Mamata's back-door entry, mysterious green file: Drama in KolkataWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee dropped in at the house of her poll strategist as the ED conducted raids linked to a money laundering case. The unprecedented turn of events has generated much controversy and turned up the heat in poll-bound Bengal.

Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will give away 75% wealth to fulfil dead son's wishWith his son's death, Anil Agarwal says his commitment to give away over 75% of earnings stands firm, signalling a deeper shift toward philanthropy, simpler living, and long-term social investment beyond business success.

Elon Musk poses with son Sekhar, name highlights his mother's India connectionThere is a fresh photo of Elon Musk's young son out on social media. And it again brings a spotlight on his Indian heritage, not just because he has been named Sekhar after famous Indian physicist Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar but also due to the Indian heritage of the kid's mom Shivon Zilis.

Live: Mamata's protest march tomorrow; I-PAC chief to file complaint against EDED Raids Pratik Jain Home Live Updates: High drama unfolded on Thursday morning in Kolkata as the Enforcement Directorate (ED) carried out raids at political consultancy firm I-PAC's office and its CEO Pratik Jain's house in relation to a money laundering case. The action drew sharp criticism from West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as she fired her shots at Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Several leaders from Trinamool Congress, including Mahua Moitra also criticised the BJP following the raids. Catch all the live updates on indiatoday.in

World's most punctual airlines revealed. And IndiGo is on the listAsk any traveller, and one shared priority everyone values is punctuality. A recent report listed the world's most on-time airlines and airports, and interestingly, one Indian name got featured too.

Yunus running own campaign as Bangladesh parties rally for polls. What's it about?As political parties in Bangladesh rally and prepare for the upcoming February 12 parliamentary elections, the interim regime's chief, Muhammad Yunus, is leading his own campaign to promote the July Charter. It is a "reform roadmap" drafted following the 2024 Anti-Hasina protests. On February 12, apart from the next government, the people of Bangladesh would also vote if they approve the July Charter, which Yunus has said is linked to "the birth of a new Bangladesh".

Bengaluru founder who once earned Rs 40,000 as Zomato rider defends Deepinder GoyalIn a post on LinkedIn, Suraj Biswas, founder of Assessli, said his support came from first-hand experience, having worked as a Zomato delivery partner in Bengaluru during 2020–21, before launching his company.

Live: We taught BJP what Hindutva is, says MNS leader Bala NandgaonkarMumbai Manthan Live Updates: Top politicians, including Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, his deputy Eknath Shinde and Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut are participating in Aaj Tak's Mumbai Manthan 2026 event ahead of the January 15 elections to 29 municipal corporations across the state, including Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). The event also sees top actors, experts and businessmen gracing the event and sharing their views about Mumbai and Maharashtra and their future. Stay tuned with India Today TV for further updates.

Two Indian truckers held in US with enough cocaine to kill over a lakh AmericansTwo Indian truckers have been arrested in the US after a routine traffic stop by Indiana State Police revealed they were smuggling over 300 pounds of cocaine worth $7 million. The DHS later stated that the truckers who lived in California had entered the US illegally and were carrying enough contraband to kill over a lakh Americans.

Kohli's brother lashes out at critics after Manjrekar's take on Test retirementVirat Kohli's brother has slammed the Indian star's critics after the recent comments made by Sanjay Manjrekar about the batter quitting Test cricket and not fighting to turn his form around in the longest format of the game.
Not Goa, not Jaipur but this Indian destination is winning over global travellersOne city in this state has emerged as the fastest-growing destination for international travellers to India.

India considers easing curbs on Chinese firms in government contracts: ReportThe curbs have had a significant economic impact, effectively excluding Chinese firms from Indian government projects worth between nearly $700 billion and $750 billion.

A message from Sri Lanka for India amid Bangladesh, Nepal turmoilSri Lankan MP Namal Rajapaksa has emphasised that India could play a central role as the South Asian region grapples with political turmoil, public unrest, and extremist threats.

Mahindra XUV 7XO review: New benchmark for seven-seater SUVs!Improving a genuinely great car is a dangerous game. The Mahindra XUV700 arrived as a benchmark, not a compromise. With the XUV 7XO, Mahindra hasn't tried to start over. Instead, it has refined, upgraded and very carefully nudged a winning formula into its next, more ambitious chapter.

After Jana Nayagan's postponement, can Prabhas' The Raja Saab get over low buzz?Prabhas' The Raja Saab gets a clear advantage after Jana Nayagan postpones its release. The film's success now hinges on its appeal beyond Telugu states amid limited North India promotion.

Tiger cub walks into Ranthambore Fort parking area in video shot by touristsAs per the caption of the post shared by the Ranthambhore National Park Instagram account, the cub is an offspring of tigress Riddhi, a well-known resident of the reserve.

ED raids I-PAC chief, Mamata Banerjee says BJP stole Trinamool's election strategyThe ED raided I-PAC offices and Pratik Jain's residence and office in Kolkata as part of a money laundering probe. Mamata Banerjee condemned the action, accusing the BJP of seizing Trinamool documents and strategy files.

Divya Spandana questions Supreme Court stand on stray dogs in viral postFormer MP and actor Divya Spandana has sparked debate by comparing the Supreme Court's concerns on stray dogs to human behaviour on social media. The court highlighted risks posed by stray animals on roads and urged stricter action against non-compliant states.

sports.headline: No champagne showers: Australia give Khawaja final tribute during Ashes celebration There were no champagne showers during the Ashes trophy celebrations as the Australian team gave a perfect tribute to the retiring Usman Khawaja after the SCG Test on Thursday, January 8.

Malaysia Open: PV Sindhu, Satwik-Chirag reach quarterfinals, men's singles run ends PV Sindhu and men's doubles pair Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty advanced to the quarterfinals of the Malaysia Open Super 1000, while India's men's singles campaign came to an end.

ICC Player of the Month: Shafali Verma named, no Indian shortlisted for men's award Young opener Shafali Verma is the only Indian cricketer nominated by the ICC for the Women's Player of the Month award for December 2025, with no Indian representation among the men's nominees.

Babar Azam gets fiery send-off by Marcus Stoinis after yet another BBL flop: Watch Babar Azam's struggles in the BBL continued as Marcus Stoinis trapped him lbw during a low-scoring clash at the MCG, though Sydney Sixers cruised to a six-wicket win over Melbourne Stars.

Former India batting coach becomes consultant for Sri Lanka ahead of T20 World Cup Sri Lanka cricket have appointed former India coach Vikram Rathour as their new batting consultant for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. Rathour was part of the Indian backroom staff when they won the T20 World Cup in 2024.

Strong SA20 season could open T20 World Cup door for Tristan Stubbs, says JP Duminy JP Duminy views Tristan Stubbs' exclusion from South Africa's T20 World Cup squad as a chance for growth, highlighting his leadership qualities and the potential for a late call-up through strong domestic performances.

Kohli's brother lashes out at critics after Manjrekar's take on Test retirement Virat Kohli's brother has slammed the Indian star's critics after the recent comments made by Sanjay Manjrekar about the batter quitting Test cricket and not fighting to turn his form around in the longest format of the game.

Sack Brendon McCullum, he is like a gambler who can't change: Geoffrey Boycott Ashes 2025-26: Geoffrey Boycott offered a stinging assessment of Brendon McCullum, Ben Stokes, and Rob Key after England's 4-1 loss, questioning the team's philosophy, accountability, and future direction. England lost the series finale by 5 wickets in Sydney on Thursday, January 8.

Brook was punched by a nightclub bouncer, nearly sacked as ODI captain: Report England vice-captain Harry Brook was reportedly close to being sacked on the eve of the Ashes after being struck by a nightclub bouncer while intoxicated, the night before the third ODI against New Zealand in Wellington on November 1.

Hardik Pandya continues Vijay Hazare onslaught, hits 9 sixes vs Chandigarh Hardik Pandya is on a tear in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. The Baroda all-rounder smashed nine sixes in a 31-ball 75, continuing a blistering run that has made him the tournament's consistent big hitter.

Sarfaraz slams fastest fifty in Vijay Hazare, hits Abhishek Sharma for 30 runs Sarfaraz Khan broke the fastest half century record in Vijay Hazare Trophy scoring 50 in 15 balls. His aggressive innings sets a new benchmark and boosts Mumbai's chances in the tournament.

Dropped from NZ ODIs, Ruturaj Gaikwad replies with record-equalling Vijay Hazare 100Ruturaj Gaikwad struck a record-equalling 15th Vijay Hazare Trophy century for Maharashtra on Thursday. The knock came days after he was dropped from India's ODI squad for the upcoming New Zealand series.

Stokes and McCullum to be sacked? England launch thorough review of Ashes defeatThe ECB has launched a detailed review following England's 1–4 Ashes loss in Australia. England managed to win just one Test during the tour, raising questions about the tactics of captain Ben Stokes and head coach Brendon McCullum.

Shaheen Afridi accuses India of violating sportsmanship, fires World Cup warningPakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi has accused India of violating the spirit of sportsmanship during Asia Cup 2025 matches. India and Pakistan players didn't shake hands during the entire Asia Cup and were even involved in heated verbal battles.

Ben Stokes hints at the end of Bazball after Ashes defeat: Teams have cracked itBen Stokes admitted teams have worked out England's Bazball approach after their 4–1 Ashes loss. Following the Sydney Test defeat, the captain hinted at a rethink rather than blind commitment to aggression.

Australia's Steve Smith unsure if he will play in 2027 Ashes in EnglandSteve Smith has cast doubt on his availability for the 2027 Ashes in England after Australia's ageing but resilient squad sealed a dominant 4-1 series victory in the home campaign.

ISL restarts, but players bear the cost: How pay cut demands spell a fresh crisisThe ISL will restart on February 14, but players are being asked to take salary cuts of up to 25 percent. With no commercial partner in place, footballers are paying the price for survival.

Damien Martyn out of hospital amid meningitis battle, Waugh calls it miracleFormer Australian batter Damien Martyn has been discharged from hospital after recovering from a serious bout of meningitis. Fellow cricketers Adam Gilchrist and Mark Waugh described his recovery as remarkable, expressing relief and gratitude for the support received during his illness.

Tottenham boss Thomas Frank trolled after spotted drinking from Arsenal cupTottenham boss Thomas Frank was trolled after being spotted with an Arsenal cup before Spurs' Bournemouth clash. The Dane later insisted he never noticed the logo, calling the controversy unnecessary and misplaced.

WPL 2026 set for new highs as Indian women's cricket finds its peakWPL 2026: The fourth edition of the Women's Premier League will be held from January 9 to February 5 across Navi Mumbai and Baroda. Mumbai Indians are the competition's two-time champions, while Royal Challengers Bengaluru lifted the title in 2024.

Ben Stokes avoids England captaincy talks after Ashes loss: Time to right our wrongsBen Stokes avoided captaincy questions after England's 4–1 Ashes loss in Australia. Speaking after the Sydney Test defeat, the England skipper focused on reflection and future plans, offering no hint of a leadership change.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi is too good for U-19 cricket: Is it too early for India debut?Vaibhav Suryavanshi's numbers in the youth level point to inevitability, but 2026 may test more than talent. As pressure, IPL responsibility and expectations grow, how he responds could define his future.

20-year-old Ayush Shetty proves big-league mettle against world championMalaysia Open 2026: It ended in defeat against World No. 1 Shi Yuqi, but Ayush Shetty walked away with something far more valuable — proof that his game stands up to the very best.

What's all this brother? Ashwin amazed by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's run-scoring spreeFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin summed up the awe around Vaibhav Suryavanshi's staggering run spree. At just 14, the teenage opener is redefining age-group dominance ahead of the Under-19 World Cup and IPL 2026.

Australia win Ashes in style, hand England 4-1 defeat, Bazball reality checkAshes: Australia secured a 4-1 series victory in the Ashes 2025-26 with a five-wicket win in the final Test in Sydney. The Steve Smith-led side chased down the target of 160 in the second session to complete a dominant series.

Versatile Beau Webster steps up in Tests as pressure grows on Cameron GreenAshes: Beau Webster's batting and off-spin on Day 4 of the final Test against England have boosted his selection prospects and intensified the pressure on Cameron Green as Australia's Test all-rounder.

Tilak Varma undergoes surgery for testicular torsion, out of New Zealand T20IsIndia have suffered a major blow ahead of T20 World Cup as Tilak Varma has sustained a testicular injury. He's unlikely to feature in the T20I series against New Zealand.

Shubman Gill meets KSI: India captain and British YouTuber link up in MumbaiIndia ODI and Test captain Shubman Gill met global YouTube star KSI in Mumbai during the latter's India visit. The casual crossover caught fans' attention ahead of Gill's return to international cricket.

Harmanpreet's captaincy record untouchable, has 4-5 more years in her: JhulanJhulan Goswami praised Harmanpreet Kaur's record as India captain and her WPL success with Mumbai Indians. She believes Harmanpreet has four to five years of cricket left and an unmatched legacy ahead of her.

Malaysia Open live: Sindhu storms into quarters, Lakshya and Ayush bow outMalaysia Open live score: PV Sindhu stormed into the quarterfinals of the Super 1000 tournament for the fourth time in her career. She outclassed eighth seed Tomoko Miyazaki of Japan in just 32 minutes. Earlier in the day, Ayush Shetty lost a valiant battle to World No. 1 Shi Yuqi in the men's singles second round. Lakshya Sen too bowed out.

Bangladesh unfairly treated? What to make of ICC's firm T20 World Cup standThe Bangladesh Cricket Board is hurt by the abrupt termination of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract. But is seeking relocation of T20 World Cup matches from India fair? The ICC has insisted Bangladesh stick to the original schedule.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
